result.execSummary:
The defendant Jevon M Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence; with 81 days credit

superMiscConds.notes: - Full-time work/school (minimum of 30 hours of work per week if in school).

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. DOC is NOT to collect during initial confinement. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jevon M Simmons

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jevon M Simmons in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Jevon M Simmons.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 81 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 30 hours of work per week if in school).
- Complete 40 hours of community service.  
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. DOC is NOT to collect during initial confinement.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Character Letter

Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court, defendant Jevon M Simmons not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informed parties that case was incorrectly assigned the case at the 7/20/2022 request for substitution.  The appropriate court assignment is Branch 40, Judge Danielle Shelton.  Court ordered case transferred to Branch 40.   Scheduling conference held.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.

Defendant Jevon M Simmons in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Jevon M Simmons in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 13CF588. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Eric Benson - Wauwatosa Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jevon M Simmons in court, appear by video with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey, appear by video.  Defendant Jevon M Simmons in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Status. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jevon M Simmons in court, appear by video with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey, appear by video.  Defendant Jevon M Simmons in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Due to court congestions, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status for waiver of prelim in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jevon M Simmons in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Jevon M Simmons in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jevon M Simmons appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
